intro: Cerophora inodora, commonly known as the odorless cerophora, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically yellow or white in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in grassland or woodland habitats. Cerophora inodora is not widely cultivated but is of interest to botanists due to its unique floral structure and ecological role.
